title: How Many Calories in 2 Pizza Slices?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in 2 pizza slices from a standard cheese pizza, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in 2 Pizza Slices?
assumptions: Standard 14-inch cheese pizza (1/8 slice per serving), hand-tossed crust, tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese; no extra toppings or dipping sauce.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by pizza size, crust type, brand, toppings, and baking method. Check restaurant or package labels for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: Two slices of cheese pizza provide about 570 kcal and 24 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged or restaurant info.

faqs.q: How many calories in one pizza slice?
faqs.a: About 285 kcal for one slice of standard cheese pizza.

faqs.q: What are the macros for 2 pizza slices?
faqs.a: Approximately 24 g protein, 20 g fat, 72 g carbs, with 5 g fiber.

faqs.q: Does pizza have a lot of sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, two slices have about 1400 mg sodium, mostly from cheese and sauce.

faqs.q: How do toppings affect calories in pizza slices?
faqs.a: Meats like pepperoni add 50+ kcal per slice; veggies add fewer, around 10-20 kcal.

faqs.q: Are these calories for cheese pizza only?
faqs.a: Yes, based on plain cheese; other toppings like sausage or veggies will increase totals.
